property.name: hbase.rootdir
property.description: Ambari Metrics service uses HBase as default storage backend. Set the rootdir for HBase to either local filesystem path if using Ambari Metrics in embedded mode or to a HDFS dir, example: hdfs://namenode.example.org:8020/amshbase.

property.name: hbase.tmp.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local filesystem. Change this setting to point to a location more permanent than '/tmp' (The '/tmp' directory is often cleared on machine restart).

property.name: hbase.local.dir
property.description: Directory on the local filesystem to be used as a local storage

property.name: hbase.cluster.distributed
property.description: The mode the cluster will be in. Possible values are false for standalone mode and true for distributed mode. If false, startup will run all HBase and ZooKeeper daemons together in the one JVM.

property.name: hbase.master.wait.on.regionservers.mintostart
property.description: Ensure that HBase Master waits for # many region server to start.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper Quorum. For example, "host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com". By default this is set to localhost for local and pseudo-distributed modes of operation. For a fully-distributed setup, this should be set to a full list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If HBASE_MANAGES_ZK is set in hbase-env.sh this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.

property.name: hbase.master.info.bindAddress
property.description: The bind address for the HBase Master web UI

property.name: hbase.master.info.port
property.description: The port for the HBase Master web UI.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.info.port
property.description: The port for the HBase RegionServer web UI.

property.name: hbase.master.port
property.description: The port for the HBase Master web UI.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.port
property.description: The port for the HBase RegionServer web UI.

property.name: hbase.hregion.majorcompaction
property.description: The time (in milliseconds) between 'major' compactions of all HStoreFiles in a region. 0 to disable automated major compactions.

property.name: phoenix.query.spoolThresholdBytes
property.description: Threshold size in bytes after which results from parallelly executed query results are spooled to disk. Default is 20 mb.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: hbase.client.scanner.caching
property.description: Number of rows that will be fetched when calling next on a scanner if it is not served from (local, client) memory.

property.name: hbase.normalizer.enabled
property.description: If set to true, Master will try to keep region size within each table approximately the same.

property.name: hbase.normalizer.period
property.description: Period in ms at which the region normalizer runs in the Master.

property.name: hbase.master.normalizer.class
property.description: Class used to execute the region normalization when the period occurs. See the class comment for more on how it works http://hbase.apache.org/devapidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/normalizer/SimpleRegionNormalizer.html

property.name: hfile.block.cache.size
property.description: Percentage of maximum heap (-Xmx setting) to allocate to block cache used by a StoreFile. Default of 0.4 means allocate 40%.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit
property.description: Maximum size of all memstores in a region server before new updates are blocked and flushes are forced. Defaults to 40% of heap

property.name: hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.lowerLimit
property.description: When memstores are being forced to flush to make room in memory, keep flushing until we hit this mark. Defaults to 35% of heap. This value equal to hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit causes the minimum possible flushing to occur when updates are blocked due to memstore limiting.

property.name: phoenix.groupby.maxCacheSize
property.description: Size in bytes of pages cached during GROUP BY spilling. Default is 300Mb.

property.name: hbase.hregion.max.filesize
property.description: Maximum HFile size. If the sum of the sizes of a region HFiles has grown to exceed this value, the region is split in two. Default is 4 GB.

property.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier
property.description: Block updates if memstore has hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier times hbase.hregion.memstore.flush.size bytes. Useful preventing runaway memstore during spikes in update traffic.

property.name: hbase.hstore.flusher.count
property.description: The number of flush threads. With fewer threads, the MemStore flushes will be queued. With more threads, the flushes will be executed in parallel, increasing the load on HDFS, and potentially causing more compactions.

property.name: phoenix.query.timeoutMs
property.description: Number of milliseconds after which a query will timeout on the client. Default is 5 min.

property.name: phoenix.query.keepAliveMs
property.description: Number of milliseconds after which a query will keep the connection to HBase alive. Default is 5 min.

property.name: hbase.client.scanner.timeout.period
property.description: Client scanner lease period in milliseconds.

property.name: hbase.rpc.timeout
property.description: This is for the RPC layer to define how long HBase client applications take for a remote call to time out. It uses pings to check connections but will eventually throw a TimeoutException.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.thread.compaction.large
property.description: Configuration key for the large compaction threads.

property.name: hbase.regionserver.thread.compaction.small
property.description: Configuration key for the small compaction threads.

property.name: hbase.hstore.blockingStoreFiles
property.description: If more than this number of StoreFiles exist in any one Store (one StoreFile is written per flush of MemStore), updates are blocked for this region until a compaction is completed, or until hbase.hstore.blockingWaitTime has been exceeded.

property.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.flush.size
property.description: Memstore will be flushed to disk if size of the memstore exceeds this number of bytes. Value is checked by a thread that runs every hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency.

property.name: hbase.snapshot.enabled
property.description: Enable/Disable HBase snapshots.

property.name: hbase.replication
property.description: Enable/Disable HBase replication.

property.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.tickTime
property.description: The length of a single tick, which is the basic time unit used by ZooKeeper, as measured in milliseconds. This property setting only affects the ZK server started by AMS in embedded mode. Unit = ms.

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout in milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout.localHBaseCluster
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout in milliseconds for pseudo distributed mode.

property.name: phoenix.sequence.saltBuckets
property.description: Controls the number of pre-allocated regions for SYSTEM.SEQUENCE table.

property.name: phoenix.query.maxGlobalMemoryPercentage
property.description: Percentage of total heap memory (i.e. Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory()) that all threads may use.

property.name: phoenix.spool.directory
property.description: Set directory for Phoenix spill files. If possible set this to a different mount point from the one for hbase.rootdir in embedded mode.

property.name: phoenix.mutate.batchSize
property.description: The number of rows that are batched together and automatically committed during the execution of an UPSERT SELECT or DELETE statement. This affects performance of group by aggregators if they are being used.

property.name: phoenix.query.rowKeyOrderSaltedTable
property.description: When set, we disallow user specified split points on salted table to ensure that each bucket will only contains entries with the same salt byte. When this property is turned on, the salted table would behave just like a normal table and would return items in rowkey order for scans

property.name: phoenix.coprocessor.maxServerCacheTimeToLiveMs
property.description: Maximum living time (in milliseconds) of server caches. A cache entry expires after this amount of time has passed since last access. Consider adjusting this parameter when a server-side IOException( “Could not find hash cache for joinId”) happens. Getting warnings like “Earlier hash cache(s) might have expired on servers” might also be a sign that this number should be increased.

property.name: phoenix.coprocessor.maxMetaDataCacheSize
property.description: Max size in bytes of total server-side metadata cache after which evictions will begin to occur based on least recent access time. Default is 20Mb

property.name: dfs.client.read.shortcircuit
property.description: Enable/Disable short circuit read for your client. Hadoop servers should be configured to allow short circuit read for the hbase user for this to take effect

property.name: hbase.unsafe.stream.capability.enforce
property.description: Controls whether HBase will check for stream capabilities (hflush/hsync). Disable this if you intend to run on LocalFileSystem. WARNING: Doing so may expose you to additional risk of data loss!
